Html:
Retribution Aura, Thorns, and Fire Shield all provide a Damage Refection buff; and there's a negligible amount of items that also provide it.

It's easy enough to add the buff and edit a model to use it based on the number of incoming hits, and that's no problem..

The problem is that all three of these buffs have coefficients based on the casters's spell power.

Should we use an "average spell power of the caster" in a coefficient in the buff, or should we possibly ignore the coefficient altogether?
Should there be different options (similar to talented Mark of the Wild) according to which spec is casting the buff?Â 

For that matter, I would need data on average spell power of Paladins, Druids, and Imps.

Any help or input on this would be appreciated!
Try and look up wws on fights where you had those buffs, iirc they're usually <5% total damage done on any fight and have pretty high resist rates too.
